column1: Table 1.03(b)   Principal offence1 for which persons charged2,3 under non-terrorism legislation where the offence is considered terrorism-related4,5
Conspiracy to destroy or damage property
Conspiracy to provide money/property to be used for acts of terrorism
Conspiracy to Breach a control order
Conspiracy to commit a public nuisance
Conspiracy to make, distribute and use with intent forged documents
Conspiracy to unlawfully acquire a firearm
Placing or dispatching articles to cause a bomb hoax
Criminal Damage Act 1971 & Malicious Damage Act 1861
Source: ACPO Counter Terrorism Coordination Centre (ACTCC).
1.     The offence shown is the principal offence for the charges made following an arrest.  When a suspect is charged with several offences the principal offence
is the most serious one based upon the maximum penalty for each offence.  Where as a suspect is charged both under terrorism legislation and for a
non-terrorist offence the principal offence may not always be be the charge made under terrorism legislation.
2.     Charge data are recorded by the year of arrest.
3.     Charged here relates to the substantive charge at indictment recorded by the Crown Prosecution Service.
4.     Based upon assessment by the ACTCC.
